data.text: @Elizabethb1976 @KarenMoriarty6 @CillizzaCNN Typical lib call someone a name and then when they come at you with facts you pretend they don't exist
@CillizzaCNN Alarming indeed.

@CillizzaCNN I don't think so dude, Comrade #BenedictDonald @realDonaldTrump supporters are only 25% of all voters. He "ain't" winning sh t with 25%. Also, it doesn't hurt that it has been confirmed that he is a TRAITOR to America. https://t.co/p1F8fuCGQg
@CillizzaCNN sunk cost fallacy principle at work, but the diehard fans start losing money or see deficits increase they might turn.
@Elizabethb1976 @CillizzaCNN I don’t know what you were reading.  This was an interesting article.  Better to state your opinions about the article then about me.

@CillizzaCNN In the PR debate, did Trump collude with Russia or not, you imply Trump’s side will win due to its huge numbers, ex: 90% of GOP trust Trump for info. But, 26% of voters identify as GOP ... 90% of 26% = 23% of US voters. 23% is a very beatable minority. https://t.co/9GJYxqb4z2
@CillizzaCNN Could Not disagree with you, more.  Trump followers & their loyalty to him will Not "save" Trump. The Conspiracy with a Foreign Enemy Will be Trump's demise - that simple. #ImpeachTrump
@CillizzaCNN A big chunk of people believed Watergate was a partisan witch hunt as well...
@CillizzaCNN How is it possible you have been covering this story non stop since it started, and this information was until now A SECRET?  @RudyGiuliani only said it in May 2018 on your own network
@CillizzaCNN Your conclusion is based on Giuliani’s public statements, as if Mueller and his team have revealed their complete strategy to anyone yet. Irresponsible speculation on your part.

@CillizzaCNN (In truth, even if Mueller did produce an email from Trump that clearly showed collusion with the Russians, I'm not sure that would change the base's view.)

This line proves your extreme bias and shallow view of the world.
@CillizzaCNN But what if Mueller uncovers financial crimes committed by Trump like he did Manafort?

@CillizzaCNN ‘... name 10 words that come to mind when someone says "Mueller probe."’

First came to mind
1. Truth
2. Hacking 
3. Conspiracy 
4. Traitors 
5. Illegitimate election
6. Re-vote 
7. Indicted Russians 
8. Lying and corrupt POTUS 
9. Complicit Republicans 
10. Impeach/indict POTUS

@CillizzaCNN This is so bad and lazy.

Everyone else isn't covered by the doj policy. Everyone else can go to jail. Everyone else is in jeopardy.

Do the second order analysis. 

I can't believe you get paid for this sophomoric garbage.

@kingscountyping @CillizzaCNN 1/3...and then he can be indicted and potentially convicted but DOJ rules would have to be overturned--that isn't going to happen. Impeachment and removal are also unlikely given a Republican majority--we have to vote him out.

@kingscountyping @CillizzaCNN 1/2 But he must be impeached and removed from office first--this doesn't alter DOJ rules--this confirms them. Impeachment is a political remedy--not a legal one regarding criminality. So Mueller can return evidence of "crimes" and Congress can impeach and remove...

@CillizzaCNN This is a Giuliani-esque exercize in semantics by @CillizzaCNN. It is actually virtually certain that this will end in proceedings involving President Trump—after his 2019 impeachment. And then he'll be in jail before the 2020 elections, and for the rest of his life. https://t.co/u2pef3sBzF

@CillizzaCNN My first thoughts when I hear the probe mentioned, being an independent, are: guilty, impeachment, indict, trial, russian agent... of course I am not a boot licking republican who lets an immoral a-hole slide on every horrible thing he does, so there is that...

@CillizzaCNN Your article also fails to mention the word *impeachment* - the process to remove a President for "high crimes and misdemeanors." If the House of Reps. moves to Democratic control after the November election, expect impeachment proceedings against Trump. https://t.co/4A8pS6wvpk
@MEverettWilbert @CillizzaCNN And here is an example that demonstrates that POTUS is not necessarily exempted from indictment or prosecution. https://t.co/ykNyWnDTk3
@italkpolitics @CillizzaCNN Yep. Chris, you have lots of bad takes but this one is extra.

@CillizzaCNN Your article does a great disservice to your readers. It's unsettled law that a President can't be indicted. Ken Starr, Special Prosecutor against President Bill Clinton drafted a memo saying presidents can be indicted. Trump may face an indictment. https://t.co/9uEs6nfOF1
@CillizzaCNN Your book review piece was so bad. It was boring and pointless.
@kingscountyping @CillizzaCNN And then there's the official DOJ page: https://t.co/NhyRgTSfx6

@CillizzaCNN Add to that the fact that an unnamed network is colluding with them to parrot their message and squash opposing viewpoints. I think Trump will get away with this and he will pardon all of his comrades.

@katpic57 @CillizzaCNN @realDonaldTrump But yet chose to call Trump a whiner  and assure the American people that are elections could not be rigged weeks before said election??how quickly facts are forgotten

@katpic57 @CillizzaCNN @realDonaldTrump Can you please tell me who the president was when all of this was "supposed" to be going on? Wasn't it the man who told Trump to quit whining when he said the election was rigged? The one who simply told Putin to cut it out? The one you had two years to expose it

@arched_ro @CillizzaCNN Well yes sir I would... I believe the media is tearing this country apart and I believe the media should report the news. His trial has absolutely nothing to do with Russia and keep in mind he has refused a plea bargain

@merclibrarian @CillizzaCNN Congress wd still need to move to impeach & GOP definitely won’t. If Dems win control in Nov & Congress successfully votes to impeach, it will support the GOP arguments of partisanship, the trump minions will cry foul and country will be even more divided...

@Elizabethb1976 @KarenMoriarty6 @CillizzaCNN Why do you call people names that you don't even know? Trump announced his campaign in 14 and took office Jan of 17 the election was Nov of 16. Obama said our elections couldn't be hacked told Trump to quit whining. He was the president why didn't he stop it? Had 2 Years..

@CillizzaCNN So how can they Impeach Clinton for a consensual BJ. Because he lied at first? Trump lies all the time. Why is it law then but now only Republican public opinion that matters? #2SetsOfLaws
@CillizzaCNN This is so damn depressing but I think you are 100% right and DJT will get away with all of it....😞

@CillizzaCNN @CillizzaCNN I hope you wrote “apples-and-oranges comparison” with a knowing smile of your face. The Justice Dept investigation being the apple, and @realDonaldTrump, fittingly, the orange.
@kingscountyping @CillizzaCNN You might read this one: https://t.co/uiKIZwcaeM
@CillizzaCNN This is all true. However, what if there the charges are obstruction of justice?

@CillizzaCNN @CillizzaCNN Your secondary point: Do not agree!  Most Americans puke when they hear “Witch Hunt”.  People care! Polls r skewed & not representative of majority. Base may not waiver; still, more vs less do ‘get it’! #LiarInChief #Vote #ImpeachTrump @realDonaldTrump #URAJoke

@kingscountyping @CillizzaCNN I have.  The current DOJ rules do not allow for it and Mueller is operating under those rules.  He can certainly be indicted after he's out of Office--and that may happen--but not while he's in Office. I don't believe everything anyone tells me--CNN or otherwise, but thanks.
@MEverettWilbert @CillizzaCNN The POTUS is not immune to indictment while in office. Read up on it - and don't believe everything CNN tells you. All they want is ratings.
@CillizzaCNN Just making stuff up again I see.

@CillizzaCNN Yes that could be the way things work out but there may be a few curve balls here. Let's see what Trump does when some of his family members are indicted. Even if he pardons them there will be political fallout.

@Elizabethb1976 @CillizzaCNN It amazes me that journalists like @CillizzaCNN couldn’t see the truth if it slapped them in the face. They ignore mounds of circumstantial evidence that’s in plain sight as if it’s inconsequential. But Mueller is connecting the dots building a fascinating picture.

@CillizzaCNN Um, it's not a secret. 
THAT'S WHY WE MUST #FlipItBlue ON NOV 6.
w/a Dem-controlled Congress—or even just a Dem controlled House—we can hold Trump accountable for whatever Mueller may report.
Flip the House, & Dems chair all committees & control Congressional investigations.
@CillizzaCNN Where has Mueller even hinted at his views on indicting a sitting president?

@CillizzaCNN I like the part where you admit Trump is using @CNN as a means to disseminate propaganda but continue to let him do just that. Trump is right about you being spineless for the wrong reasons

@kingscountyping @CillizzaCNN 2/2...will be the answer to our hopes for a swift and undignified end to the Trump presidency but it is highly unlikely.  Ask most attorneys and they will tell you the same thing. Now, Trump might face legal trouble once he's out of office but not before.

@kingscountyping @CillizzaCNN 1/2 It's not "blather"---these are facts. Current DOJ rules do NOT allow for the criminal indictment of a sitting president--the rules were changed after the Clinton impeachment and he has to abide by them. Too many of us have been over-confident that the Mueller investigation...
@CillizzaCNN you are way off on this Sparky.  This is not public opinion this is saving a nation.  Mueller has shown nothing and you are purely speculating, when this is done prepare to be shocked.
@CillizzaCNN Such an important piece to read!

@CillizzaCNN You are actually telling us what Robert Mueller is thinking? And that there is no chance Mueller won't indict a sitting "president?" And that thugs Giuliani and Trump are confident this will all end in a PR spin? Ridiculous blather  - embarrassing for CNN.
@stacylynn_17 @CillizzaCNN @FoxNews @marklevinshow oh god...

@JLangWood @CillizzaCNN @FoxNews Just saying.. if you were listening to conservative talk radio you would already know that collusion is not a crime and that a sitting president cannot be indicted. First 50 years ago and again 30 years ago during Clinton administration became doj policy @marklevinshow

@stacylynn_17 @CillizzaCNN @FoxNews It's 'million' not 'billion'. and it's not true.
https://t.co/Ms5xOMCdJn

@KarenMoriarty6 @CillizzaCNN Can you explain to me how 2 years, the FBI,Cia,special counsel, and every news organization in America.. and still not one indictment regarding CONSPIRING with Russia? If all those people were investigating you would they have come up with a crime by now? At least speeding?

@BuyMyDietShakes @supralaps1517 @CillizzaCNN Why would we read the article when he told us it was a secret that only they know.. if he doesn't know the secret why would we waste our time. The Senate has never voted to remove a president and a sitting president cannot be indicted.#millions$$wasted

@JLangWood @CillizzaCNN @FoxNews I guess everyone on the left that their fingers in their ears and chanted nana nana boo boo while Putin was talking about Hillary getting 400 billion dollars from Russia
@CillizzaCNN I wonder how CNN will cover that Manafort trial today. Will they be honest and admit that it has absolutely nothing to do with the president?

@CillizzaCNN Let me guess that a sitting president cannot be indicted. And the Senate has never voted to impeach and remove a president from office so all of our tax dollars are being wasted on this stupid investigation

@CillizzaCNN Brainwashing the public consciousness into complete error is what @FoxNews and Conserv Talk radio has been all about all these years. But the public has had to watch their president publicly bow to Russian Leader Putin--and he will continue to have to do so. Factor that in
@CillizzaCNN If you are the one delivering the news why would you think we have a misconception #Fakenews

@CillizzaCNN I think we’re all in for a surprise. You wrongly surmise that Mueller is only going after Trump. There are many criminal players involved. Evidence has led him to many members of the GOP. That changes the dynamics and the public relations battle too, because they can be indicted.
@CillizzaCNN What you are missing here is when Mueller threatens to send Don Jr. , Ivanka, and Jarrod to prison in exchange for Trumps confessions.

@CillizzaCNN How sad the president is above the law. He is a lying bully who uses his power to discredit all those who disagree with him. Bad behavior, no accountability and treating people like shit are the new norm and have no consequences.  Welcome to the new America. Sad.
@CillizzaCNN That Hillary colluded and the MSM wont report it? That's not a secret. #MAGA2018
@CillizzaCNN You’re right, and it makes me sad that, in this post-truth era, facts do not matter.  Right does not matter.
